thread.title: Large photo collection donated to upstate New York college
thread.title_full: Large photo collection donated to upstate New York college - seattlepi.com

author: seattlepi.com
title: Large photo collection donated to upstate New York college
text:
SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y. (AP) â€” An upstate New York college has received a donation of hundreds of images that span the history of photography and include the works of such famous photographers as Robert Mapplethorpe , Alfred Stieglitz , Richard Avedon and Diane Arbus .
Skidmore College says photographer Jack Shear of Spencertown in Columbia County has donated more than 500 photos to the school's Tang Teaching Museum . Officials at the private liberal arts college in Saratoga Springs say the collection includes some of the earliest examples of war photography and portraits of such 20th-century figures as poet Carl Sandburg .
The gift also includes one of the earliest photographic images of Niagara Falls and photographs of American Indians taken by Edward Curtis in the early 20th century.
Photos from the Shear collection will be on display at the Tang Museum from Feb. 6 through Aug. 14.
